00032 // Interface for the class Structure. A structure contains a single set of
00033 // variables, all at the same lexical level. Of course, a structure may
00034 // contain other structures... The variables contained in a structure are
00035 // stored by instances of this class in a SLList of BaseType pointers.
00036 //
00037 // jhrg 9/14/94
00038 
00039 #ifndef _structure_h
00040 #define _structure_h 1
00041 
00042 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00043 #ifdef _GNUG_
00044 #pragma interface
00045 #endif
00046 #endif
00047 
00048 #include <vector>
00049 #include "Pix.h"
00050 
00051 #ifndef _basetype_h
00052 #include "BaseType.h"
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #ifndef _constructor_h
00056 #include "Constructor.h"
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 #ifndef _dds_h
00060 #include "DDS.h"
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 #ifdef TRACE_NEW
00064 #include "trace_new.h"
00065 #endif
00066 
00067 
00098 class Structure: public Constructor {
00099 private:
00100     std::vector<BaseType *> _vars;
00101     
00102     void _duplicate(const Structure &s);
00103     BaseType *leaf_match(const string &name, btp_stack *s = 0);
00104     BaseType *exact_match(const string &name, btp_stack *s = 0);
00105 
00106 public:
00107     Structure(const string &n = "");
00108 
00109     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::const_iterator Vars_citer ;
00110     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::iterator Vars_iter ;
00111 
00112     Structure(const Structure &rhs);
00113     virtual ~Structure();
00114 
00115     Structure &operator=(const Structure &rhs);
00116     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00117 
00118     virtual int element_count(bool leaves = false);
00119     virtual bool is_linear();
00120 
00121     virtual void set_send_p(bool state);
00122     virtual void set_read_p(bool state);
00123     virtual void set_in_selection(bool state);
00124 
00125     virtual unsigned int width();
00126 
00127     virtual bool serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00128                bool ce_eval = true);
00129     virtual bool deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *dds, bool reuse = false);
00130 
00131     // Do not store values in memory as for C; force users to work with the
00132     // C++ objects as defined by the DAP.
00133 
00134     virtual unsigned int val2buf(void *val, bool reuse = false);
00135     virtual unsigned int buf2val(void **val);
00136 
00137     virtual BaseType *var(const string &n, bool exact = true,
00138               btp_stack *s = 0);
00139 
00140     virtual BaseType *var(const string &n, btp_stack &s);
00141 
00142     virtual void add_var(BaseType *bt, Part part = nil);
00143 
00144     Pix first_var();
00145 
00146     void next_var(Pix p);
00147 
00148     BaseType *var(Pix p);
00149 
00151     Vars_iter var_begin() ;
00152 
00155     Vars_iter var_end() ;
00156 
00157     Vars_iter get_vars_iter(int i);
00158 
00159     virtual void print_decl(ostream &os, string space = "    ",
00160                 bool print_semi = true,
00161                 bool constraint_info = false,
00162                 bool constrained = false);
00163 
00164     virtual void print_decl(FILE *out, string space = "    ",
00165                 bool print_semi = true,
00166                 bool constraint_info = false,
00167                 bool constrained = false);
00168 
00169     virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "",
00170                bool print_decl_p = true);
00171 
00172     virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "",
00173                bool print_decl_p = true);
00174 
00180     virtual void print_all_vals(ostream& os, XDR *src, DDS *dds,
00181                 string space = "", bool print_decl_p = true);
00182 
00194     virtual void print_all_vals(FILE *out, XDR *src, DDS *dds,
00195                 string space = "", bool print_decl_p = true);
00196 
00197     virtual bool check_semantics(string &msg, bool all = false);
00198 };

00264  * redefine Pix to be an IteratorAdapter. Usage remains the same and all code
00265  * outside of the DAP should compile and link with no problems. Added methods
00266  * to the different classes where Pix is used to include methods to use STL
00267  * iterators. Replaced the use of Pix within the DAP to use iterators instead.

00275  * and usage.cc actually use pthreads synchronization functions. In other
00276  * cases I removed static objects where they were used for supposed

00289  * subclassing is still the best way to go, but you're not required to do
00290  * it anymore.

00292  * Revision 1.37.4.3  2002/03/01 21:03:08  jimg
00293  * Significant changes to the var(...) methods. These now take a btp_stack
00294  * pointer and are used by DDS::mark(...). The exact_match methods have also
00295  * been updated so that leaf variables which contain dots in their names
00296  * will be found. Note that constructor variables with dots in their names
00297  * will break the lookup routines unless the ctor is the last field in the
00298  * constraint expression. These changes were made to fix bug 330.

00309  * Revision 1.37.4.1  2001/06/05 06:49:19  jimg
00310  * Added the Constructor class which is to Structures, Sequences and Grids
00311  * what Vector is to Arrays and Lists. This should be used in future
00312  * refactorings (I thought it was going to be used for the back pointers).
00313  * Introduced back pointers so children can refer to their parents in
00314  * hierarchies of variables.
00315  * Added to Sequence methods to tell if a child sequence is done
00316  * deserializing its data.
00317  * Fixed the operator=() and copy ctors; removed redundency from
00318  * _duplicate().
00319  * Changed the way serialize and deserialize work for sequences. Now SOI and
00320  * EOS markers are written for every `level' of a nested Sequence. This
00321  * should fixed nested Sequences. There is still considerable work to do
00322  * for these to work in all cases.

00327  * wrapped headers included in other headers in those guard symbols (to cut
00328  * down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00329  *
00330  * Revision 1.36  2000/09/21 16:22:08  jimg
00331  * Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00332  * Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00333  * two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00334  * InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00335  * the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00336  * is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.

00408  * deserialize mfuncs. Connect was also modified so that it manages the data
00409  * source `object' (which is just an XDR pointer).

00447  * Changed the name of the configuration header file from `config.h' to

00449  * installed in the DODS include directory without overwriting this one. Each
00450  * config header should follow the convention config_<name>.h.
00451  *
00452  * Revision 1.10  1995/03/04  14:35:07  jimg
00453  * Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00454  * Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00455  * contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00456  * Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00457  * class represenation.
00458  * Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00459  * types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00460  * an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00461  * Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00462  * objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00463  * C would store them.
00464  * Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00465  * an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00466  * objects).
00467  *
00468  * Revision 1.9  1995/02/10  02:22:58  jimg
00469  * Added DBMALLOC includes and switch to code which uses malloc/free.
00470  * Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.
00471  * Added new accessors for name and type fields of BaseType; the old ones
00472  * will be removed in a future release.
00473  * Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00474  * internal buffer.
00475  * Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00476  * Fixed read_val().
00477  * Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00478  * cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
00479  * Fixed print_val().
00480  *

00483  * implementations.

00485  * mfunc read_val (to be consistant with the other mfunc names).
00486  * Removed the unnecessary duplicate declaration of the abstract virtual
00487  * mfuncs read and (now) read_val from the classes Byte, ... Grid. The
00488  * declaration in BaseType is sufficient along with the decl and definition
00489  * in the *.cc,h files which contain the subclasses for Byte, ..., Grid.
